message: When Jessa was 21, a woman approached her after recognizing that she displayed signs of an abused or trafficked person. She gave Jessa a slip of paper with her name and contact information before telling her to call for help anytime. That woman owned a safe house in Colorado where she helped to protect and rehabilitate survivors of human trafficking. Escaping wasn’t something the 21-year-old had ever considered at the time—she simply never realized she had a choice.

data.description: "My past no longer has the power to hold me captive."
data.title: 10-Yr-Old is Sold to Pimps by Her Own Family—11 Years Later, a Stranger Slips Her a Note…
